articles.description: Wales must go through the play-offs to reach 2024, the Premier League returns this weekend, and all the football gossip in the papers.
articles.title: Wales reaction, back pages and latest football news

articles.description: Lionel Messi says there "could have been a tragedy" after Argentina's World Cup qualifier against Brazil in Rio is delayed because of crowd trouble.
articles.title: There could have been a tragedy - Messi

articles.description: Ronnie O'Sullivan says he is at a "crossroads" with snooker's governing body and could quit the sport if he has to reduce the time he spends in China.
articles.title: O'Sullivan future in doubt as he hits 'crossroads'

articles.description: Manager Robert Page says Wales will "throw everything" into the Euro 2024 play-offs after missing out on automatic qualification following a controversial draw with Turkey.
articles.title: Wales target Euro play-offs after Turkey controversy

articles.description: Anthony Mullally lifted the biggest prize in northern hemisphere rugby league, but his emptiness on doing so led him to a life far from the bright lights and big stage.
articles.title: The remote retreats shaping men and medal prospects

articles.description: Wimbledon's expansion plans suffer another setback after Wandsworth Council vote against the All England Club's proposals.
articles.title: Wimbledon expansion plans suffer another setback

articles.description: Chantelle Cameron relives her historic victory over Katie Taylor before Saturday's rematch in Dublin.
articles.title: 'I actually did it, I beat Katie Taylor' - Cameron relives historic victory

articles.description: Chairman John Elkann "couldn't be happier" about the prospects of Ferrari returning to the top of F1 under Frederic Vasseur.
articles.title: 'Tighter, closer Ferrari heading in right direction'

articles.description: Watch live coverage as Scotland's men take on Netherlands in the European Curling Championships.
articles.title: Watch: Scotland men v Netherlands

articles.description: LeBron James helps the LA Lakers beat the Utah Jazz 131-99 to reach the quarter-finals of the inaugural in-season tournament.
articles.title: James becomes first player to 39,000 points
